summary: Cannot test runtime behavior - no mechanism to set org to past_due status without TKT-005c webhook implementation

failures.criterion: All acceptance criteria require runtime testing
failures.expected: Ability to set organization subscription_status to 'past_due' to trigger and test the PaymentBlocker modal
failures.actual: No database access, no TKT-005c webhook handlers implemented, no way to test modal appearance or behavior
failures.evidence: Ticket depends on TKT-005c (webhook handlers) to set past_due status. Without webhooks or direct database access, cannot trigger the modal to verify any acceptance criteria.

failures.criterion: Ticket should be testable in isolation
failures.expected: Ticket marked complete should be fully testable without depending on incomplete tickets
failures.actual: TKT-005b depends on TKT-005c (status: ready, not done) to set past_due status via webhooks
failures.evidence: tickets.json shows TKT-005c status='ready' (not done). Dev completion report says 'Manually set org to past_due in database' but no database access provided to QA agent.

code_review_notes: Code inspection shows correct implementation: PaymentBlocker component properly checks subscription_status, conditionally renders admin/agent UI, modal is non-dismissible with z-50 overlay, layout integration is correct. All changes within scope. No security issues found.
recommendation: This ticket needs either: (1) Complete TKT-005c first to enable webhook-based status setting, OR (2) Provide QA with database credentials to manually set past_due status, OR (3) Add a dev/test mode toggle to simulate past_due status
